alert.note: Alert for Bergen; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 10:11AM EST until December 20 at 6:00AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Jersey...New York... Ramapo River near Mahwah affecting Orange, Rockland, Passaic and Bergen Counties. For the Ramapo River...including Mahwah...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ramapo River near Mahwah. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Major flooding along Route 202 and Route 17 intersection. Road closed. Flooding along Riverview Drive and along Halifax Road and Bridle Path Lane. Flooding on Brakeshoe Place, Brook Street and Catherine Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM EST Monday was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.4 feet on 08/19/1955. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Ramapo River Mahwah 8.0 10.6 Mon 9 am EST 9.2 7.3 MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM EST.
